This skin (Jaximus) features a memorial tribute to Joe, a Ewings Sarcoma patient who visited Riot thanks to the Make A Wish Foundation. Joe passed away on June 5, 2012. The movement quote for the Jaximus skin, Joe's favorite, was changed to "Here's to you, kid!" in his memory.
 (https://soundcloud.com/marktheking/gladiatorjax-move6) this is the sound file for those unaware)

For those complaining about how this is just a "cash grab" and how riot is being money-hungry, here's 2 things to think about.

1. Riot, last I checked, is a company. They have the LCS and equipment to afford, lighting/electricity (with so many servers, work computers, etc; can you imagine their electric bill?), salaries for their employees, and other expenses that they have to pay. League is a /free game/ and so letting people spend money on microtransactions (What's keeping them in business) isn't unreasonable.

2. SKINS ARE OPTIONAL!!! Nobody is forcing you to buy these skins. Riot isn't making league a pay-to-play game. Riot isn't making you, for example, have to buy any champions you're missing only with real life money. If they did, I guarantee Riot wouldn't have as big of a playerbase.

They're a company that needs to stay in business. I understand that all of these skins should make the people that already own them feel like they should get some sort of additional reward, but the fact you have a skin that now, nobody else can get for a really long time (I'm talkin' months, here.) should be a reward in and of itself.

Tl;Dr - Stop QQing. Riot's a business. Either buy the skins or don't. It isn't that hard not to complain about their business decisions.
